citation.article-title: Methanogenium liminatans spec. nov., a new coccoid, mesophilic methanogen able to oxidize secondary alcohols.

p.s: Description of Methanogenium liminatans sp. nov.

Methanogenium liminatans (Li.mi'na.tans, M. L. subst, masc. limus meaning sludge and M. L. adv. natans from natare, swimming. Methanogenium liminatans spec. nov., a motile, coccoid methanogen occurring in industrial sludge)
Single, irregular cocci of about 1.5 μm in diameter.
Cell envelope consists of hexagonally arranged glycoproteins, Mr of subunits 118 000.
Growth in a synthetic, acetate- containing low-salt medium with H2/CO2, formate, 2-propanol/CO2, 2-butanol/CO2 or cyclopentanol/CO2 as substrates.
No growth or methane production with acetate, methanol, ethanol or dimethylamine.
No dependence on NaCl within the range 0 -600 mM, no growth at >0.8 M NaCl.
Autotrophically grown cells contain high amounts of putrescine, besides spermidine, sym-homospermidine and spermine.
Polar lipid pattern similar to that of other Methanogenium species.
Secondary alcohol dehydrogenase dependent on F420.
The G + C content of the DNA is 59.3 mol% (Tm) and 60.5 mol% G + C (HPLC).
The habitat of Methanogenium liminatans strain DSM 4140 is a Biohochreaktor of the Hoechst AG (Kelsterbach, FRG).
Strain DSM 4140 has been deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung für Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen GmbH, D-3300 Braunschweig (FRG) under DSM 4140.
